subject: Mental Health
title: Self-Harm in Adolescents
description: A quick, practical guide to Self-Harm in Adolescents.

hook.text: About 1 in 5 teens has engaged in self-harm â€” most never tell an adult.

buildup.text: Self-harm is used to cope with overwhelming emotions when other strategies aren't available.

discovery.text: Physical pain triggers endorphins and temporarily overrides emotional pain.

twist.text: Self-harm is not a suicide attempt â€” but it does increase future suicide risk significantly.

climax.text: Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT) teaches alternative coping skills and reduces self-harm.

punchline.text: Self-harm is a language of pain. The answer is teaching a better one.
